what: Example 1: generate a dataset from a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Suppose database GCAM version v7.1 named myDb folder named dbFolder want generate standardized dataset several scenarios: scen1, scen2 scen3. generate_report function generate automatically save folder myDb located. Follow installation guide either R Docker. Load gcamreport library. using Rstudio Docker, run using R, run Store database path name, query path, desired project name, GCAM-core compatible version, desired scenarios reporting variables variables. case specify scenarios, scenarios database considered reporting; variables specified, available reporting variables used. details scenarios variables specification, look regions’ tutorial variables’ tutorial. want specify GWP version look GWP tutorial want specify query files, look query files tutorial. Notice extension included project name. Accepted extensions .dat & .proj. Note: followed Docker installation, place database inside gcamreport folder, now considered root R session. Inside R session referred /app. Thus, database path something like /app/path//database. Generate standardized dataset desired year. example, 2050. default 2100 least 2025. Note: project generation might take time, depending number scenarios, regions, variables want standardize. Notice dataset automatically saved .RData, .csv .xlsx /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.RData, /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.csv, /path//database/awesomeProj_standardized.xlsx. procedure also generate project file /path//database/dbname_prjname.dat loaded queries. can directly use indicated Example 2. terminal output performed vetting verification final status. newline
code: devtools::load_all() library(gcamreport) dbpath <- "/path/to/database" dbname <- "gcamdb_name" prjname <- "awesomeProj.dat" scen <- c("scen1", "scen2", "scen3") GCAMv <- "v7.1" generate_report(db_path = dbpath, db_name = dbname, prj_name = prjname,                  GCAM_version = GCAMv, scenarios = scen, final_year = 2050,                 launch_ui = FALSE)

what: Example 3: save or not the output and specify the file format or the directory
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Suppose situation one previous examples, want either save standardized output, save .csv, .xlsx, extensions. Follow installation guide either R Docker. Load gcamreport library. using Rstudio Docker, run using R, run Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters like consider generate_report function (e.g., final year, desired scenarios…). Specify output saving options save_output parameter: Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function. Specify output directory output file name output_file parameter. save output indicated path .csv .xlsx. modify extension, check step 3. newline
code: devtools::load_all() library(gcamreport) ## -- save the dataset in CSV and XLSX format generate_report(..., save_output = TRUE)    # this is the default option  ## -- save the dataset only in CSV format generate_report(..., save_output = 'CSV')  ## -- save the dataset only in XLSX format generate_report(..., save_output = 'XLSX')  ## -- do not save the dataset generate_report(..., save_output = FALSE) ## -- save the dataset in '/desired/directory' and in a file called 'awesomeOutput' generate_report(..., output_file = '/desired/directory/awesomeOutput')

what: Example 4: specify the regions or regions’ group/s
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Suppose one previous situations, want consider standardized dataset regions. two ways select : can directly specify desired regions considered, can specify group(s) regions considered. either case, desired regions form World. , example, total arable land world sum arable land selected regions. Follow installation guide either R Docker. Load gcamreport library. using Rstudio Docker, run using R, run Check available regions regions’ groups reporting. following commands print list possibilities. case want store vector, can simply assign output. can also skip console printing setting print = FALSE. Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function (e.g., final final, desired scenarios…). Specify regions desired_regions parameter desired_continents parameter. Notice can specified time. newline
code: devtools::load_all() library(gcamreport) available_regions() available_continents() avail_reg <- available_regions(print = FALSE) avail_cont <- available_continents() ## -- specify the desired regions generate_report(..., desired_regions = c('EU-15','EU-12'))  ## -- specify the desired regions' group/s generate_report(..., desired_continents = c('ASIA','REF'))

title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: Suppose situation one previous examples, want consider variables standardized dataset. Follow installation guide either R Docker. Load gcamreport library. using Rstudio Docker, run using R, run Check available variables reporting. following command print list possibilities. case want save vector, can simply assign output. can also skip console printing setting print = FALSE. Use example1 database example2 project description add extra parameters consider generate_report function (e.g, final year, desired scenarios…). Specify variables desired_variables parameter. can specify vector desired variables names fully written, also consider variables start name. last feature, allows easily select variables within group, Emissions, Emissions|CO2, Agricultural Demand case specify variables within group, make total value. example, select Final Energy|Electricity Final Energy|Gases, Final Energy sum two sectors, consider Final Energy|Industry Final Energy|Heat. newline
code: devtools::load_all() library(gcamreport) available_variables() avail_var <- available_variables(print = FALSE) ## -- specify the desired variables generate_report(...,                desired_variables = c('Agricultural Demand|Crops|Energy',                                     'Agricultural Demand|Crops|Feed',                                     'Capacity Additions|Electricity|Wind|Onshore',                                      'Emissions|BC|Energy*')) # This will select,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Industry,                                                               # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Residential and Commercial,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Demand|Transportation,                                                              # Emissions|BC|Energy|Supply

what: A) Error on generate_report considering a database
title: Dataset Generation Tutorial
text: running generate_report(db_path = "path///data/myData.dat""), might see error R console: problem might due incorrect package installation incorrect database placement. Possible solution 1: ensure cloned repo. Check instructions . Possible solution 2: ensure placed database folder specifying. can , extracted database zip folder, intermediate folder appeared. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance db_path = C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\database using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: ensure database inside gcamreport folder. ensure typed correctly path gcamreport folder generating docker image (5th step Docker section) ensure pointing correctly database. example, gcamreport folder folder called some_databases database amazingDatabase, refer Possible solution 3: ensure place database main gcamreport folder. database placed subfolder within gcamreport folder outside gcamreport. Due tot known issue rgcam package, placing database man folder supported. newline
code: > generate_report("path/to/your/data/myData.dat") [1] "Creating project..." /home/user/basex/.basex: writing new configuration file. Error in localDBConn(db_path, db_name, migabble = FALSE) :    Database does not exist or is invalid: examples/database_basexdb_ref In addition: Warning messages: 1: In normalizePath(dbPath) :   path[1]="examples": No such file or directory 2: The following named parsers don't match the column names: name, date, version # option 1: full path generate_report(db_path = "/app/some_databases", db_name = "amazingDatabase")  # option 2: partial path generate_report(db_path = "some_databases", db_name = "amazingDatabase")

text: example, assume GCAM version modified version GCAM core 7.0, additional altered agricultural items. goal run generate_report function adjust mapping files directed messages displayed console gcamreport package. Follow either full R installation Docker installation. Open gcamreport.Rproj. Run generate_report function pointing database indicating similar GCAM-core version: project file generated, may take time. completed, reporting standardization begin. first error encounter may look something like : error indicates mapping file ag_demand_map contain required items computing ag_demand_clean variable. resolve , follow steps:    3.1) Locate variable generation code:      ) Open file R/functions.R gcamreport folder.      b) Search (Ctrl + F) variable ag_demand_clean, generated within get_ag_demand() function.    3.2) Identify missing items:      ) Navigate section code uses left_join_strict() function:      b) Add break point beginning section re-run generate_report function , time pointing project file instead database avoid regenerating project stop breaking point:      c) find missing items, assign lines left_join_strict function variable mapping items another variable. , compare two sector intended left_join_strict function. Use following example:    3.3) Update pre-build mappings:      ) Add missing items ag_demand_map mapping file. Note mapping files can sometimes saved different names. find correct file, open inst/extdata/saveDataFiles_GCAM7.0.R search (Ctrl + F) ag_demand_map: example, mapping file located inst/extdata/mappings/GCAM7.0/ag_demand_map.csv. Open file, add missing items, save changes. Note: don’t want include certain items report, can add line new item indicating NoReported variable: Note: error persists prefer update mapping file , can modify left_join_strict call code dplyr::left_join. However, please aware approach recommended, may compromise strict matching intended data processing. choose option, please follow next Step 3.4, source R/functions.R file, use Step 3.5 ensure new chuck read.    3.4) Stop debugging process.    3.5) Update package data:      ) Run inst/extdata/saveDataFiles_GCAM7.0.R script update package data.      b) Rebuild package documentation using Ctrl + Shift + D navigate Build > > Document.      c) Install updated package going Build > Install. Run generate_report function , time pointing project file instead database avoid regenerating project: reporting procedure start immediately ag_demand_map mapping arranged correctly, new error prompt regarding ag_prices_map: Repeat procedure outlined Step 3 correct ag_prices_map file. Iterate Step 4 standardization process complete. code:
## Contents - [Contents](#contents) - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Installation Guide](#installation-guide) - [With R](#with-r) - [Light mode installation](#with-R-light-mode-installation) - [Full mode installation](#with-R-full-mode-installation) - [With Docker](#with-docker) - [Getting Started](#get-started) - [Warnings and Error Messages](#bugs) ## Introduction [Back to Contents](#contents) `gcamreport` is a tool that generates a consistent dataset from any scenario run by the Global Change Analysis Model ([GCAM](http://www.globalchange.umd.edu/gcam/)) that meets the reporting requirements of the Integrated Assessment Modeling Consortium ([IAMC](https://www.iamconsortium.org/)). In addition, `gcamreport` includes an interactive user widget that allows users to generate and download plots live, as well as download reduced versions of the formatted dataset in spreadsheet format. ## Installation Guide [Back to Contents](#contents) There are multiple equivalent ways to install this package: ### With R There are two ways to install the `gcamreport` package through R. The [light mode installation](#with-R-light-mode-installation) requires only R as it installs the `gcamreport` package directly from the GitHub repository. It is suitable for general use of the package but not compatible with the user interface. The [full mode installation](#with-R-full-mode-installation) requires R, Rstudio and cloning the GitHub repository. It is suitable for general use of the package and allows you to launch the user interface. It is also the best option if you are actively developing or modifying the `gcamreport` package, as it allows you to modify the mappings and functions to create suitable versions for your GCAM model. #### Light mode installation 1. Requirements - R (to download, click [here](https://www.r-project.org/)) 2. Open R and install the `gcamreport` package: ``` r install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github('bc3LC/gcamreport') ``` Now `gcamreport` package is fully loaded. Enjoy! :smile: **Note**:boom:: If you want to install specific `gcamreport` versions, indicate the tag or branch name when running the installation command. For instance: ``` r # to install the tagged version "v6.0.1" devtools::install_github('bc3LC/gcamreport@v6.0.1') # to install the branch version "gcam-v6.0" devtools::install_github('bc3LC/gcamreport@gcam-v6.0') ```
#### Full mode installation 1. Requirements - R (to download, click [here](https://www.r-project.org/)) - Rstudio (to download, click [here](https://www.rstudio.com/)) - Git (to download, click [here](https://git-scm.com/downloads/)) 2. Open git bash in the folder where you want to clone the repository and clone it: ``` bash git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git ``` 3. Load the `gcamreport` package: Open the `gcamreport` folder you just cloned and double-click the `gcamreport.Rproj` file. RStudio should open the project. Load the library: ``` r install.packages('devtools') devtools::load_all() ``` Now `gcamreport` package is fully loaded. Enjoy! :smile: **Note**:boom:: If you want to install specific `gcamreport` versions, indicate the tag or branch name when cloning the repository. For instance: ``` bash # to clone the tagged version "v6.0.1": git clone --branch v6.0.1 --single-branch https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git # to clone the branch version "gcam-v6.0": git clone --branch gcam-v6.0 https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git ```
### With Docker This installation method allows you not to worry about the R libraries and dependencies. Docker provides you with an already updated environment suitable for running the `gcamreport` package. 1. Requirements - Docker Desktop (to download, click [here](https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/)) - Git (to download, click [here](https://git-scm.com/downloads)) 2. Open git bash in the folder where you want to clone the repository and clone it: ``` bash git clone https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git ``` 3. Open Docker Desktop (double-click the icon on your computer) and leave it running in the background. 4. Inside a terminal (bash or cmd) pull the docker image: ``` bash docker pull claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:gcam-v7.0-v2 ``` **Note**:exclamation:: This step requires 13.5GB of free space in your computer. 5. Run the Docker container using your full path to the `gcamreport` folder: ``` bash docker run -v /path/to/gcamreport:/app -p 4000:3838 -it claudiarodes/gcamreport_docker:gcam-v7.0-v2 ``` This should prompt an R console in your terminal. 6. Install the `gcamreport` package in the new R console: ``` r remotes::install_github("bc3LC/gcamreport") #you can skip all updates in case you are asked library(gcamreport) ``` Now `gcamreport` package is fully loaded. Enjoy! :smile: **Note**:exclamation:: To access local files, you should place them in the `gcamreport` folder, which is now considered the root of the R session. Inside the R session it is referred to as `/app`. **Note**:exclamation:: To reuse the docker image, you can simply perform steps 3, 5, and 6, since the docker image is already on your computer. **Note**:exclamation:: If you followed the [Docker installation](#with-Docker), to open the user interface (UI) once it has been launched, either go to the Docker Desktop and type the last port started, or type in your browser. **Note**:boom:: If you want to install previous `gcamreport` versions, indicate the tag or branch name when cloning the repository (step 2). For instance: ``` bash # to clone the tagged version "v6.0.1": git clone --branch v6.0.1 --single-branch https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git # to clone the branch version "gcam-v6.0": git clone --branch gcam-v6.0 https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport.git ```
## Getting Started [Back to Contents](#contents) The `gcamreport` package consists of a set of functions divided into two different blocks: - Dataset generation: It creates or loads an existing project and automatically saves the generated dataset that meets the reporting requirements of the [IAMC](https://www.iamconsortium.org/). Main function: `generate_report()`. For more information, see this [tutorial](https://bc3lc.github.io/gcamreport/articles/Dataset_Generation_Tutorial.html) or type `??generate_report` in your R console. If you get any warning or error messages, you might want to look at the [Warnings and Error Messages](#bugs) section. - Interactive user block: it launches an interactive widget that displays the dataset in tabular form, with the ability to filter, reorder and download live. It also displays plots and allows them to be downloaded, aggregated by variables, regions and scenarios. Main function: `launch_gcamreport_ui()`. For more information see this [tutorial](https://bc3lc.github.io/gcamreport/articles/Interactive_UI_Tutorial.html) or type `??launch_gcamreport_ui` in your R console. If you get any warning or error messages, it might be useful to have a look at the [Warnings and Error Messages](#bugs) section. The package also includes some default input files (.Rda) that are read by the different functions. These can be changed by the user as detailed in [this tutorial](https://bc3lc.github.io/gcamreport/articles/Modify_Mapping_Template_Tutorial.html).
## Warnings and Error Messages [Back to Contents](#contents) Some typical and already-known errors that can be easily solved! :bulb: :computer: Error on "run("path/to/your/data/myData.dat")" In your R console, you might see this error: > generate_report("path/to/your/data/myData.dat") [1] "Loading project..." [1] "Loading data, performing checks, and saving output..." [1] "ag_demand_clean" Error in rgcam::getQuery(prj, "demand balances by crop commodity") : getQuery: Query demand balances by crop commodity is not in any scenarios in the data set.
**Possible solution** This problem is due to a wrong path specification. Thus, make sure that you specified correctly the path. In addition: - In case you are using `gcamreport` package following the [R installation](#with-r), try to copy the whole path to your data, for instance `C:\Users\username\Documents\path\to\your\data\myData.dat` if you are using a Windows distribution. - In case you are using `gcamreport` package following the [Docker installation](#with-docker): a) make sure that your data is inside the `gcamreport` folder. b) make sure that you type correctly the path to your `gcamreport` folder when running the docker image (5th step in the [Docker section](#with-docker)) c) make sure that you are pointing correctly to your data. For example, if in the `gcamreport` folder you have a folder called `amazingData` with your dataset `myData.dat`, you should refer to it as ``` r # option 1: full path generate_report("/app/amazingData/myData.dat") # option 2: partial path generate_report("amazingData/myData.dat") ```

:computer: Wired message when launching the UI when using the Docker installation. After using the functions `generate_report()` or `launch_gcamreport_ui()` to launch the UI, you might get this message: Listening on http://0.0.0.0:3838 /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: www-browser: not found /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: links2: not found /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: elinks: not found /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: links: not found /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: lynx: not found /usr/bin/xdg-open: 882: w3m: not found xdg-open: no method available for opening 'http://127.0.0.1:3838'
**Possible solution** This is not an error! You simply need to either go to your Docker Desktop program and click the last started port or open this url in your favourite browser.

:computer: Error when using the UI through Docker installation. When oppening your *localhost*, you might see this error:
**Possible solution** Your UI is not running. Try to either use the `generate_report()` function or the `launch_gcamreport_ui()`.

:computer: Error related to *system* when using the Docker installation. Once the R console is opened, you might see this message after introducing any command: System has not been booted with systemd as init system (PID 1). Can't operate. Failed to connect to bus: Host is down Warning message: In system("timedatectl", intern = TRUE) : running command 'timedatectl' had status 1

code: devtools::load_all() library(gcamreport) ## -- store the database path, name, and scenarios in a variable. dbpath <- "examples" dbname <- "database_basexdb_ref" scen <- "Reference" GCAMv <- "v7.1"  ## -- choose a project name prjname <- "example1_v7.1.dat"  ## -- generate the reporting dataset until 2050 for EU-12 and EU-15 for all the  ## -- Agricultural variables, save the output in .RData, .csv and .xlsx format,  ## -- and lunch the user interface generate_report(db_path = dbpath, db_name = dbname, scenarios = scen,                  prj_name = prjname, final_year = 2050, GCAM_version = GCAMv,                 desired_regions = c('EU-12', 'EU-15'),                  desired_variables = c('Agricultural*'),                  save_output = TRUE, launch_ui = TRUE)

Main function: generate_report(). information, see tutorial type ??generate_report R console. get warning error messages, might want look Warnings Error Messages section. Interactive user block: launches interactive widget displays dataset tabular form, ability filter, reorder download live. also displays plots allows downloaded, aggregated variables, regions scenarios. Main function: launch_gcamreport_ui(). information see tutorial type ??launch_gcamreport_ui R console. get warning error messages, might useful look Top common Warnings Error Messages section. package also includes default input files (.Rda) read different functions. can changed user detailed tutorial.

what: Top common Warnings and Error Messages
title: gcamreport
text: Back Contents typical already-known errors can easily solved! 💡 💻 Error “generate_report(prj_name =”path///data/myData.dat”)” R console, might see error: problem due wrong path specification. Thus, make sure specified correctly path. addition: case using gcamreport package following R installation, try copy whole path data, instance C:\Users\username\Documents\path\\\data\myData.dat using Windows distribution. case using gcamreport package following Docker installation: make sure data inside gcamreport folder. make sure type correctly path gcamreport folder running docker image (5th step Docker section) make sure pointing correctly data. example, gcamreport folder folder called amazingData dataset myData.dat, refer  💻 Error “generate_report(…)” R console, might see error: problem due mismatch ag_demand_map map. Thus, make sure specified correctly GCAM_verions parameter generate_report function. error persists, look tutorial.  💻 Wired message launching UI using Docker installation. using functions generate_report() launch_gcamreport_ui() launch UI, might get message: error! simply need either go Docker Desktop program click last started port  open url http://localhost:4000 favourite browser.  💻 Error using UI Docker installation. oppening localhost, might see error:  UI running. Try either use generate_report() function launch_gcamreport_ui().  💻 Error related system using Docker installation. R console opened, might see message introducing command: Simply type Ctrl+C run command .  Note:💥 errors, please check troubleshooting sections generate_report function user interface widget. error listed, please open Issue GitHub page information reproduce crash.

title: create_project — create_project
text: db_path Optional. Full path GCAM database. Required creating new project. db_name Optional. Name GCAM database. Required creating new project. prj_name Name GCAM project. Can existing project name (loads project) new project name (creates new project). Accepts extensions: .dat .proj. scenarios Names scenarios include. Defaults scenarios available project database. desired_regions Regions include report. Defaults ''. Specify vector specific regions. view available options, run `available_regions()`. Note: dataset include specified regions, forming "World" project. desired_variables Variables include report. Defaults ''. Specify vector specific variables. view available options, run `available_variables()`. Note: Global variables like "Emissions" account selected variables. example, selecting "Emissions" "Emissions|CO2" make "Emissions" account "Emissions|CO2", excluding variables "Emissions|CH4" "Emissions|NH3". GCAM_version Main GCAM compatible version: 'v7.0' (default), 'v7.1', 'v6.0'. queries_general_file Optional. Full path general XML query file (including file name extension). Defaults general query file compatible specified `GCAM_version` reports standardized variables. queries_nonCO2_file Optional. Full path XML query file (including file name extension) non-CO2 queries, "nonCO2 emissions sector (excluding resource production)" "nonCO2 emissions region". Defaults non-CO2 query file compatible specified `GCAM_version`.

title: generate_report — generate_report
code: generate_report(   db_path = NULL,   db_name = NULL,   prj_name,   scenarios = NULL,   final_year = 2100,   desired_variables = "All",   desired_regions = "All",   desired_continents = "All",   save_output = TRUE,   output_file = NULL,   launch_ui = TRUE,   GCAM_version = "v7.0",   GWP_version = "AR5",   queries_general_file = NULL,   queries_nonCO2_file = NULL )

title: generate_report — generate_report
text: db_path Full path GCAM database. Required creating new project. db_name Name GCAM database. Required creating new project. prj_name Name GCAM project. Can existing project name (loads project) new project name (creates new project). Accepts extensions: .dat .proj. scenarios Names scenarios consider. Defaults scenarios project database. final_year Final year data. Defaults 2100. Note: `final_year` must least 2025 must align available 5-year intervals, 2025, 2030, 2035, 2040, etc. desired_variables Variables include report. Defaults ''. Specify vector specific variables. view available options, run `available_variables()`. Note: Global variables like "Emissions" account selected variables. E.g., select "Emissions" "Emissions|CO2", "Emissions" account "Emissions|CO2", account variables "Emissions|CH4" "Emissions|NH3". desired_regions Regions include report. Defaults ''. Specify vector specific regions. view available options, run `available_regions()`. Note: dataset include specified regions, make "World". desired_continents Continent/region groups include report. Defaults ''. Specify vector specific groups. view available options, run `available_continents()`. Note: dataset include specified groups, make "World". save_output `TRUE` (default), saves reporting data CSV XLSX formats. `FALSE`, data saved. 'CSV' 'XLSX', data saved specified format. output_file File path name saving data. specified, defaults directory database project file default name containing 'standardized'. Provide full path without extension, automatically added. launch_ui `TRUE` (default), launches User Interface. `FALSE`, launch UI. GCAM_version Main GCAM compatible version: 'v7.0' (default), 'v7.1', 'v6.0'. GWP_version Global Warming Potential (GWP) version: 'AR5' (default), 'AR6', 'AR4'. queries_general_file Optional. Full path general XML query file (including file name extension). Defaults general query file compatible specified `GCAM_version` reports standardized variables. queries_nonCO2_file Optional. Full path XML query file (including file name extension) non-CO2 queries, "nonCO2 emissions sector (excluding resource production)" "nonCO2 emissions region". Defaults non-CO2 query file compatible specified `GCAM_version`.

title: gcamreport 7.0.1
text: gcamreport package suitable GCAM 7.0 💥 Novelties: JOSS Publication. Allow gcamreport used without cloning repository using .Rproj file. Now suitable running clustered machines. Allow specify query files. Add default options selecting database rgcam project scenarios. Add tutorials mapping modifications query files specifications. Add fix user checks. Improve update package documentation. Improve package’s robustness. Optimize package. Clean variables cache. Fix transport mapping. Fix non-ASCII characters. Reduce package dependencies. Full Changelog: https://github.com/bc3LC/gcamreport/compare/v7.0.0…v7.0.1
